parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To reconcile, change from one state of feeling to another. From apo and katallasso; to reconcile fully.
Both (of two). Comparative of amphi; both.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Enmity, hostility, alienation. Feminine of echthros; hostility; by implication, a reason for opposition.
